data.title: MontrÃ©al films and TV to watch at home
data.meta_description: This article was updated on January 18, 2021. From international films to hit TV series, MontrÃ©al entertains with award-winning on-screen creations. Catch up on or rewatch films by QuÃ©bec directors and stream binge-worthy MontrÃ©al-made TV.
data.text:
Living room film fest

Discover new art house films and more from MontrÃ©al indie cinemas' programming, including virtual screenings from CinÃ©ma Moderne, CinÃ©ma du Parc, CinÃ©ma du MusÃ©e and CinÃ©mathÃ¨que quÃ©bÃ©coise. Watch hundreds of QuÃ©bec documentaries, features and short films online at the National Film Board of Canada, including films by Alanis Obomsawin, Norman McLaren, Claude Jutra, Donald Brittain and more cinematic greats. The PHI Centre's VR TO GO delivers truly engaging world-class VR content (and headsets) to your door. And explore the city from a cinematic distance in these Hollywood movies made in MontrÃ©al.

Classics by QuÃ©bec directors

Now is also the time to discover or rediscover QuÃ©bec directors too, many of whom have films for rent online or currently screening on Netflix and other streaming services: among the many to check out, watch films by Denys Arcand (Jesus of MontrÃ©al, The Barbarian Invasions), Xavier Dolan (Mommy, The Death & Life of John F. Donovan), Jean-Marc VallÃ©e (C.R.A.Z.Y., Dallas Buyers Club, Wild), Denis Villeneuve (Sicario, Arrival, Blade Runner 2049) and LÃ©a Pool (Worst Case We Get Married).

Binge-worthy QuÃ©bec TV

Whether French is your mother tongue or not, watching QuÃ©bec-made TV is sure to connect you to the province's rich culture (not to mention that more TV shows are providing French and English subtitles â very helpful when you're learning!). Of the many shows featuring MontrÃ©al, check out comedic crime show SÃ©rie Noire, police drama 19-2, time-travel drama Plan B, urban crime drama District 31, dramatic comedy M'entends-tu, psychological suspense Cerebrum, and cinematic drama-comedy Amours d'occasion â all on streaming service ici.tou.tv. And why not watch Anthony Bourdainâs Layover episode about MontrÃ©al again (or at least some clips of it), our Somebody Feed Phil episode on Netflix, as well as TVO's hour-long episode Montreal - The Life-Sized City.
